overview.title: Overview
overview.content: Known as the 'Gibraltar of the East', Vijaydurg Fort is one of Maharashtra’s oldest and strongest sea forts. Originally built by Raja Bhoja II and later expanded by Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, the fort stands majestically on the Konkan coast, surrounded by the Arabian Sea on three sides.

highlights.title: Highlights
points: Massive sea fort with triple-layered walls and 20 bastions
Served as the main base of the Maratha Navy under Kanhoji Angre
Hidden underwater wall built to trap enemy ships
Spectacular views of the Arabian Sea and surrounding coastline
Historical ship anchorage visible during low tide

architecture.title: Architecture
architecture.content: Vijaydurg Fort’s architecture showcases the brilliance of Maratha engineering. The fort is built using laterite stones and has strong defensive walls, bastions, granaries, wells, and hidden escape tunnels.
features: Granaries, wells, and storage areas inside the fort
Stone carvings and old temple remnants

history.title: History
history.content: Built in the 12th century by Raja Bhoja II of the Shilahar dynasty, the fort was later captured and strengthened by Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj in 1653. It became one of the key naval bases of the Maratha Empire and played an important role in sea defense and trade.
events: Built by Raja Bhoja II in the 12th century
Captured and renovated by Shivaji Maharaj in 1653
Served as the headquarters of Maratha Navy under Kanhoji Angre
Witnessed British-Maratha conflicts in the 18th century

attractions.title: Attractions
places: Ruins of temples and residential areas
Panoramic sea views from the ramparts

activities.title: Activities
options: Explore the massive sea fort and bastions
Boating around the fort during high tide
Taste authentic Malvani cuisine in nearby villages

modes.byRoad: Vijaydurg is about 490 km from Mumbai and 220 km from Ratnagiri. Regular buses and private vehicles are available via NH66.
modes.byTrain: Nearest railway station is Rajapur Road, about 60 km away. Local taxis and buses connect to Vijaydurg.
modes.byAir: Nearest airport is Ratnagiri Airport (220 km).

bestTimeToVisit.title: Best Time to Visit
bestTimeToVisit.content: The ideal time to visit Vijaydurg Fort is from October to March, when the weather is pleasant and the sea views are stunning.

tips.title: Travel Tips
points: Carry enough drinking water and snacks; options near the fort are limited.
Wear comfortable shoes for walking and climbing.
Hire a local guide to learn about the fort’s history and hidden underwater wall.
